intro: Cruciata pedemontana var. glabrescens, commonly known as the Alpine cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the genus Cruciata in the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its distinctive five-petaled flowers. The variety glabrescens is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves and stems, which set it apart from other varieties of the species. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
